page.title: 10Mellifont Abbey
page.content: Mellifont Abbey today is a superb private residential home for the elderly at present owned by Mrs. Julie Shawe. The residents are well cared for in pleasant surroundings. There is a 24-hour monitoring service and intercoms and emergency alarms in all rooms. The building itself is set in about three acres of lawns and gardens. It was built about l73O by Colonel Piers who owned the manor of Wookey and the adjoining estate and it stands on the site of an earlier rectory house. The building is impressive because the West Front has a central tower and the top is surrounded by a parapet with mock battlements. Colonel Piers named it Mellifont Abbey and surrounded it with gardens and fish ponds and enclosed it by a high brick wall which still exists today.
